Strikes at South Korean Hospitals
articles.content:
Strikes at South Korean Hospitals 
    Pyongyang, June 14 (KCNA) -- Over 10,000 members of hospital trade unions simultaneously went on a strike on June 10 at 100 or more hospitals, according to MBC of south Korea.
 The unionists had been holding negotiations with the employers to push their demand to cut the working hours and increase the wages. When the negotiations came to a rupture, they immediately called a strike.    
 MBC said the current strike of hospital trade unions is the biggest ever in scale and the number of strikers is expected to increase with the passage of time.

Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Nigerian Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Nigerian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, June 14 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Sule Buba, new ambassador e. p. of the Federal Republic of Nigeria to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 Present were officials concerned and a staff member of the Nigerian embassy.

articles.title: North Side's Delegation Arrives in Inchon
articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Arrives in Inchon
    Pyongyang, June 14 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by Kim Jong Ho, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and the Arts of Korea, left here Monday to participate in the Koreans' meeting to mark 4th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 Joint Declaration to be held in Inchon of south Korea.
 Also leaving here were a delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China led by its Chairman Yang Yong Dong and a delegation of Koreans in Japan led by Chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for the Peaceful Reunification Ri Jong Hwal.    
 The delegations arrived in Inchon on the same day. The spokesman for the north side's delegation made public an arrival statement at the airport.

articles.title: North-South Joint Photo Exhibition Opens
Delegation of North Side Leaves Here
articles.content:
Delegation of North Side Leaves Here
    Pyongyang, June 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the north side headed by Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korean Asia-Pacific Peace Committee left here today to attend an international seminar marking the fourth anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration to be held in Seoul.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by An Kyong Ho, director of the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, and officials concerned.
